definitions.title: n.[m.]
definitions.body: prob. bdellium (SyrVer bduwlh.o0; Targum [[בְּדוּלְחָא]]; etym. dub.; Lag:Ges. Abh. 20 prop. Skr. udûkhala) c. art. ´[[הַבְּ]], apparently therefore well known; one of the products of the land Havilah Ge 2:12; used in simile of colour of manna [[וְעֵינוֹ כְּעֵין הַבְּדׂלַח]] Nu 11:7.—Meaning somewhat uncertain; LXX Ge 2:12 a)/nqrac, Nu 11:7 kru/ stallov; Saad. AW Ki Bo al. pearls, cf. Lag Or. ii. 44; Jos:Ant. iii. 1. 6 Aq Theod Symm Targum most bdellium, an odoriferous transparent gum, of yellowish colour. (Cf. Smith:Dict. Bible Sigismund:Aromata, 18.)
